chunk_id: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC__chunk_65
source: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC
text:
The normal pulse rate is 60â€“90 beats per minute. If the pulse rate is persistently high or low, with or 
without other symptoms, the woman requires medical attention at the PHC/FRU.
Measure and record Respiratory rate:
Normal respiratory rate is 18-20 breaths per minute. If the RR is above 30 breaths per minute and pallor 
is present, it indicates severe anemia, heart disease or other associated medical problems. 
She must be immediately referred to the PHC-Medical Officer for further investiga
